Class GameModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class GameModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    The class GameModel holds the model, the state of the systems. It stores the followiung information: - the current location of the blue dot - the state of all the dots on the board (available, selected or occupied by the blue dot - the size of the board - the number of steps since the last reset The model provides all of this informations to the other classes trough appropriate Getters. The controller can also update the model through Setters. Finally, the model is also in charge of initializing the game
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setModel

        public void setModel(int[][] newModel)

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the model to (re)start a game. The previous game (if there is one) is cleared up . The blue dot is positioned as per instructions, and each dot of the board is either AVAILABLE, or SELECTED (with a probability 1/INITIAL_PROBA). The number of steps is reset.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Getter method for the size of the game
        Returns:
        the value of the attribute sizeOfGame

      • getCurrentStatus

        public int getCurrentStatus(int i,
                            int j)
        returns the current status (AVAILABLE, SELECTED or DOT) of a given dot in the game
        Parameters:
        i - the x coordinate of the dot
        j - the y coordinate of the dot
        Returns:
        the status of the dot at location (i,j)

      • select

        public void select(int i,
                   int j)
        Sets the status of the dot at coordinate (i,j) to SELECTED, and increases the number of steps by one
        Parameters:
        i - the x coordinate of the dot
        j - the y coordinate of the dot

      • setCurrentDot

        public void setCurrentDot(int i,
                          int j)
        Puts the blue dot at coordinate (i,j). Clears the previous location of the blue dot. If the i coordinate is "-1", it means that the blue dot exits the board (the player lost)
        Parameters:
        i - the new x coordinate of the blue dot
        j - the new y coordinate of the blue dot
